content.content:
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "legalities"
(
    id     INTEGER not null
        primary key autoincrement,
    format TEXT,
    status TEXT,
    uuid   TEXT
        references cards (uuid)
            on update cascade on delete cascade
);

content.text: Now I can see the relevant columns: `legalities.status` for 'restricted' and `cards.isTextless` for text boxes. Let me run the query.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/card_games.sqlite" "SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT c.id) FROM cards c JOIN legalities l ON c.uuid = l.uuid WHERE l.status = 'Restricted' AND c.isTextless = 0;"
input.description: Count unique restricted-status cards with text boxes

content.text:
The query returns exactly 535, matching the claim.

Let me also verify the case-sensitivity of the status value:

The status value is indeed 'Restricted' and the count of unique cards with restricted status and text boxes (isTextless = 0) is exactly 535, matching the claim.
